meanings.definition: A photographic image in which light areas appear light and dark areas appear dark.
meanings.sent1: The photopositive showed a clear distinction between light and dark areas in the picture.
meanings.sent2: I prefer photopositive prints because they accurately represent the contrast in the scene.
meanings.sent3: The photopositive of the beach made it look like a black and white painting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile in the photopositive was as bright as the sun in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The photopositive of the forest made the shadows look like mysterious creatures lurking.

meanings.definition: A substance that reacts to light by becoming more visible or changing color.
meanings.sent1: The photopositive on the paper became more visible as the light hit it.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a photopositive material that changed color under different lighting conditions.
meanings.sent3: The photopositive on the wall seemed to glow in the dark, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her mood ring acted like a photopositive, reflecting her emotions through color changes.
meanings.sent5: The photopositive fabric shimmered like a rainbow under the sunlight.
